title: Semgrep Language Server Configuration
description: This server can be configured using `workspace/didChangeConfiguration` method. Each configuration option is described below:

semgrep.scan.configuration.description: Each item can be a YAML configuration file, directory of YAML files ending in .yml | .yaml, URL of a configuration file, or Semgrep registry entry name. Use "auto" to automatically obtain rules tailored to this project; your project URL will be used to log in to the Semgrep registry.

semgrep.scan.exclude.description: List of files or directories to exclude.

semgrep.scan.include.description: List of files or directories to include.

semgrep.scan.jobs.description: Number of parallel jobs to run.

semgrep.scan.severity.description: Severity of rules to scan for.

semgrep.scan.maxMemory.description: Maximum memory to use in megabytes.

semgrep.scan.maxTargetBytes.description: Maximum size of target in bytes to scan.

semgrep.scan.timeoutThreshold.description: Maximum time to scan in seconds.

semgrep.lsp.watchOpenFiles.description: Scan all opened files automatically on open and save.

semgrep.lsp.watchWorkspace.description: Scan all workspace folders automatically on open and when folders are added or removed.

semgrep.lsp.watchConfigs.description: Watch all semgrep config files for changes and rescan when they are saved. semgrep.lsp.watchWorkspace must also be enabled.

semgrep.lsp.autodetectConfigs.description: Automatically detect configuration files in workspace folders according to the glob pattern **/{semgrep,.semgrep}.{yml,yaml}

semgrep.lsp.ciEnabled.description: When logged in, the LSP will runs rules configured on Semgrep App
